summary: Based on the provided documents, Leo T. Clark is mentioned in the context of FBI responses to Congressional committee requests, particularly those from the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC). The documents relate to inquiries about investigations, COINTELPRO, security clearances for Senate Select Committee staff, and an incident involving an FBI informant. However, the documents do not provide specific details about Leo T. Clark's role or involvement in these matters, nor do they directly connect him to the JFK assassination. His name appears within the context of administrative matters and responses to congressional inquiries concerning FBI activities.
key_connections: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC)
significance: The provided documents do not establish any direct significance of Leo T. Clark in the JFK assassination context. His mention is related to FBI responses to congressional inquiries regarding various investigations and administrative matters.
